article.headline: Central Florida 83, Mercer 58
article.story: MACON, Ga. (AP) -- Dexter Lyons had 12 of his 17 points in the second half and Roberto Morentin scored 14, helping Central Florida beat Mercer 83-58 Thursday night. Reserve Josh Peppers added 13 for the Golden Knights (20-4, 15-2), who won for the 18th time in 20 games and moved into a tie for the top spot in the A-Sun with idle Troy State. UCF outscored Mercer 40-20 in the paint. James Odoms finished with 10 points as the Bears (10-16, 7-10) lost their fourth straight. They cut an 11-point deficit down to six early in the second half on a 3-pointer by Scott Emerson, but UCF pulled away with a 30-9 run over the next 13 minutes.
